alert.note: Alert for Redwood; Renville (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 12 at 10:37AM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Yellow Medicine, Lac qui Parle and Chippewa Counties. .Thunderstorms dropped 2 to 4 inches of rain across portions of southern Minnesota Wednesday night into Thursday morning, mainly south of the Minnesota River. This has caused river levels to rise on the Cottonwood and Minnesota River, and the rivers are expected to crest this weekend upstream of Mankato. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Morton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet water reaches flood mitigation culverts on Riverside Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 AM CDT Friday, the stage was 21.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 AM CDT Friday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 05/02/2006. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
